summary: The best Linux file manager I have worked with

description: My favorite file manager for Linux , however it doesn't show up on the launch pad in some distributions (Fedora, AntiX, MX, Ubuntu) so you have to launch from the command line.

This is the only sane GNOME file manager, but as noted by others, this app does not show up in the app launcher out of the box (see https://github.com/mate-desktop/caja/issues/1458 ).

A simple workaround is to create your own copy of the app's .desktop file, but with the 'OnlyShowIn=' line removed. To do that, open the Terminal app and run the following two commands:

cp /usr/share/applications/caja-browser.desktop ~/.local/share/applications/
sed -i '/^OnlyShowIn=/d' ~/.local/share/applications/caja-browser.desktop
summary: Really good...after a simple config tweak for GNOME/KDE based distros
This should be the default file manager with gnome

description: It does not work on Fedora 35, then why it's in the software list!!
summary: It does not work on Fedora 35
